text:
Top Riviera Maya Chefs Showcasing Their Gastronomy With Cooks Collective Published on : Friday, September 11, 2015
Leading chefs of the Riviera Maya have banded together to create a culinary collective that will host regular dinners to showcase the gastronomic excellence and creative juices of the destination’s top hotels and restaurants.
Seven chefs are participating in the Cooks Collective Riviera Maya (COCO.RM):
Jorge Ildefonso, La Marea, Viceroy Riviera Maya
Alejandro Cuatepotzo, Nibs, Hotel Cacao
Karla Enciso, Aroma Cilantro, The Palm
Juan Diego Solombrino, The Imprevist
Roberto Solombrino, The Plank
Xavier Perez, Stone of Axiote
Edgar Demecio, La Fisheria
“This is an unprecedented opportunity for our guests to sample the creative talents of the extraordinary chefs of the Riviera Maya,” said the Viceroy Riviera Maya’s Chef Ildefonso. “We will be working together, combining our unique individual skills with the region’s great abundance of fresh, top-quality foods from the land and sea, to make each dinner an unforgettable dining experience.”
COCO.RM will hold a series of dinners through November 2015 with four chefs participating in each dinner. The location of the dinners, which are limited to 20 diners, will rotate among the members of the collective:
September 23: La Fisheria: Chef Demecio with the chefs from Viceroy Riviera Maya, Hotel Cacao and The Plank.
October 7: The Plank: Chef Solombrino with the chefs from Viceroy Riviera Maya, Hotel Cacao and La Fisheria.
October 21: La Marea, Viceroy Riviera Maya:Chef Ildefonso with the chefs from Stone of Axiote, The Plank and The Palm at Playa. For reservations please call: (011-52) 984 877 3000
October 31: Stone of Axiote: Chef Perez with the chefs from The Palm at Playa, Viceroy Riviera Maya and The Imprevist.
November 4: Aroma Cilantro, The Palm at Playa: Chef Enciso with the chefs from The Plank, The Stone of Axiote and The Imprevist.
November 18: The Imprevist: Chef Solombrino with the chefs from Hotel Cacao, La Fisheria and The Stone of Axiote.
La Marea restaurant at Viceroy Riviera Maya embraces Mexico’s rich culinary heritage while simultaneously incorporating new interpretations and techniques into the menu. “Some of the most wonderful dishes are created by adding a slice of innovation to an historic recipe,” enthused Executive Chef Jorge Ildefonso. “One of the joys of going on vacation,” he added, “is having new experiences that are inspiring and memorable. We want guests to return home and tell friends about the exciting dishes with bold flavors they tasted at La Marea.” Top-flight ingredients are the foundation of La Marea’s kitchen. Ingredients are specially procured for their quality and origin, mostly from local or regional sources, but also from across the country. Guests dine on a romantic loft with views of the aquamarine Caribbean in a casual, open-air tropical ambiance flavored by rattan furniture, a large palapa roof and gentle sea breezes.
Viceroy Riviera Maya is a serene all-villa hideaway where guests experience true relaxation, gracious villa living, exquisite dining, personalized pampering, healing spa treatments and much more in a stunning ambiance combining lush jungle with a sugary-white-sand beach lapped by the warm turquoise waters of the Caribbean.
